post: As America celebrates its 250th year, Civics Playbook organizations are launching fresh initiatives and doubling down on proven programs that have been sparking curiosity, strengthening civic pride and bringing the nations founding ideals to life for communities nationwide. Thank you to the Civics Playbook organizations Ashbrook Center, Bill of Rights Institute, Center for American Civics, Center for Civic Education, Civic Spirit, Florida Education Foundation, Founding Forward, Institute of American Civics, izzit.org, The Jack Miller Center, The John Jay Institute, Junior Achievement of Georgia, National Constitution Center, The Rendell Center for Civics & Civic Engagement, TeenPact and Museum of the American Revolution for your ongoing commitment to strengthening civic engagement across our country. We are excited to share your work and celebrate the impact you are having in communities nationwide. Learn more:  https://hubs.la/Q041NKTQ0

Haley Rubios NCSS recap = classroom-ready wins: DBQs for multilingual learners, Supreme Court cases through story, and civic games. Which would you try next week?  https://bit.ly/4as88DP  #NCSS  #SocialStudies  #CivicsEducation  #TeacherPD

You already taught the civics moment. Now bank the chance. Each Civic Star submission adds another shot at recognition + $300 classroom awards. Tag a colleague who should log theirs.  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #Teachers  #K12

Deadline extended to Feb 17: the  #NationalCivicsBee starts with a 4-question community-issue essay, then live rounds run on BRI-written questions. Tag a school that should join.  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice  #Teachers

AI is reshaping classrooms fast, so whats the right rule? Should students use AI tools for academic work, or does it weaken learning and integrity? Have students submit their take by Feb 12:  https://bit.ly/3NOXJcJ  #ThinkTheVote  #CivicEducation  #DigitalCitizenship  #CriticalThinking

February is your students runway: start small now, build steadily, submit by May 3. MyImpact Challenge is open to students 13-19, with a chance at $10,000. Share this with a student who wants to make an impact:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #ProjectBasedLearning  #CivicEducation  #YouthLeadership

Twenty students. One national cohort. BRIs 2026 Student Fellows were nominated by educators and selected through essays on leadership and citizenship, then spend six months practicing dialogue, building projects, and meeting civic leaders. Tag a teacher who should nominate a future Fellow. Read the full article:  https://bit.ly/4qXYaQD  #CivicEducation  #LeadershipDevelopment  #Civics  #Education  #StudentLeadership

Applications for the 2026 National Civics Bee close Feb. 3. Students progress through rounds powered by BRI-authored questions and materials. Comment with BEE  if youre sharing this with a school community.  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #NationalCivicsBee  #CivicEducation  #StudentOpportunity  #YouthLeadership

Incredibly proud to see  #AZGYC represented among the 20 students selected nationwide for the 2026 Bill of Rights Institute Student Fellowship! 🎉 Analiese Alexanders dedication to serving her local City of Maricopa community and her efforts to elevate youth voices on statewide education panels highlight the commitment of our young leaders toward achieving the  #ArizonaPromise of an  #ArizonaForEveryone. We look forward to seeing her positive impact continue to shine at a national level through this six-month civic fellowship! Congratulations! 👏  https://lnkd.in/gQFfe_wk

The next Civic Star Challenge cycle closes in just 2 days. In ~2 minutes (no uploads), you can log a civics lesson for a chance at $300 classroom awards + student swag.  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #K12  #America250
